Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include various types of plants in each habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants).
The student can include different types of animals in each habitat (e.g., lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, clams).
The student can show how different living things might be found in the land habitat compared to the water habitat.
The student can illustrate patterns in the diversity of living things across the two different habitats.
